page.title: 11RESIDENTIAL SCHOOL
page.content: Melville House is a residential school in N.E. Fife. Once a private home, this listed Georgian building is set in 15 acres of land. In 1976 it was bought by Fife Regional Council and is now run by the Social Work and Education Departments. This sort of management structure is unique in Scotland. The school is for up to 40 boys who have had problems coping with the ordinary school system or are considered to be outwith parental control or have been removed from home for safety. It is open 365 days/year and looks to fill 3 basic needs: nurture: care: education. Meetings, attended by everyone, are an important part of the working life of Melville House. The boys are encouraged to account for their actions in front of their peers.
